Don't be inhibited by the stairs! There are a lot (41) to get down to the house, but once you are there, you are steps from the lake.
You enter in to the upstairs which is where the bedrooms and bathrooms are located. There is a set of stairs with a sturdy rail leading down to the lower level where the kitchen, living room and dining room are located.
Everything was clean and tidy when we arrived. There were plenty of kitchen amenities available and no need for paper plates. The fridge is large and easily held all our supplies with room to spare. A dishwasher is there to make cleanup a breeze and the soap was under the sink. I LOVED the custom table that easily sat 8 people. It was great not only for meals, but to play games at in the evening. The nice touches of the string lights made it even better. There were games there, including a Euchre set that was great!
The deck was wonderful to lounge on in the couch that went the entire length, with comfortable cushions. There were plenty of adirondac chairs for everyone, along with a few beach chairs. There is a very large sand area that goes from the deck all the way to the water. It was great for my grandson who loved all the sand toys to play with and made it easy to keep an eye on him. We made use of the available kayaks, the lake is not too large and can easily be handled by even an amateur. There was a pedal boat available too which the kids loved. A fire pit is available to use as well.
There was a gas grill there to use and it ran out of gas while we were there. I messaged Marlene and she informed me they already had a full one there waiting. What a pleasant surprise! No interruptions to our mini vacation. Also, between the room air conditioners and dehumidifiers, it stayed comfortable our entire stay.
In case you were wondering, there is a Meijer and a Walmart less than 10 miles away in case you want to just grab your groceries after you get there like we did.
I would definitely stay here again! The only reason I did not give it 5 stars were things that Marlene could not control. The WiFi went down after the first night, I'm guessing due to the recent storms in the area. I didn't mind as much, but the adult children whined more than the kids! LOL And we had an issue with some bees in the area.
